titleStmt.title: By the Queene. Whereas the Queenes Maiestie our most gratious soueraigne Lady, by reason of the plague and pestilence, aswell in the citie of London, as in the citie of Westminster, and in diuerse other places and parts of this her Maiesties realme, did lately by her highnes procalamation adiourne part of the tearme of Saint Michael . . .
Proclamations. 1578-11-14
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)
Elizabeth I, Queen of England, 1533-1603.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Christopher Barker, printer to the Queenes Maiestie [i.e. B. Norton and J. Bill],

notesStmt.note: Michaelmas Term is adjourned further because of plague.
Actual printers' names and suggested publication date from STC.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
